arch:property.oc:show_val: This locus is an area of cobbles and pottery sherds laying flat in situ next to the south baulk. This locus is also the removal locus for this feature. The pottery and cobbles appear to be sloping down the tepe very much like the feature in L4008. These cobbles are generally smaller than the ones in L4008 and there is a lot of pottery scattered amongst them. There is one spot at the south baulk that has no cobbles but the soil does not indicate a pit or surface.
This surface/collapse could be related to L4008 cobble area
loosely packed areas with harder packed sil t around the stones and pottery
this area of fill is softer than the soil in L4008 where the other cobble surface is. These cobbles are smaller than L4008 and contain more pottery.

arch:note.arch:string: Contexts excavated in trenches were recorded using the "locus system." A locus is any discrete three-dimensional entity excavated in a trench. The key to the locus system is the recognition that a locus is any one thing. Differences in soil composition or texture are therefore as important as, for example, the difference between a pit and a wall. If two entities were distinct, they were considered separate loci and were therefore assigned separate locus numbers. It should also be noted that every context excavated in a trench was given a locus number and thus the trench itself is made up completely of excavated loci.

arch:property.oc:show_val: cobbles and pottery lying flat on tepe slope
may be associated with large cobble area L4008
It looks like a collapse layer with small cobbles and areas of flat lying pottery and some blank spots without cobbles or pottery

oc:metadata.dc:title: Kenan Tepe: Area B / Trench 4 / Locus 4018 (Locus)
